meanings.definition: Failure to perform an act that one is legally obligated to do.
meanings.sent1: The employee's nonfeasance in completing the required safety training led to a workplace accident.
meanings.sent2: The court found the defendant guilty of nonfeasance for not fulfilling their contractual obligations.
meanings.sent3: The nonfeasance of the forgetful mail carrier resulted in undelivered packages scattered around the post office.
meanings.sent4: Her nonfeasance in maintaining the garden turned the once vibrant flowers into withered petals.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of nonfeasance can have serious legal repercussions.

meanings.definition: The omission of an act that should have been done.
meanings.sent1: The student's nonfeasance in submitting the assignment on time affected their grade negatively.
meanings.sent2: The company faced a lawsuit due to nonfeasance in disclosing important information to investors.
meanings.sent3: The nonfeasance of the chef forgetting to add salt to the soup made it taste bland.
meanings.sent4: The nonfeasance of the mechanic in changing the oil caused the engine to seize up.
meanings.sent5: Nonfeasance can lead to missed opportunities and damaged relationships.
